scikit-dimension API¶

The module global_id provides global intrinsic dimension estimators (i.e., one value for the entire dataset) and the module local_id contains local intrinsic dimension estimators (i.e., functions provide values that are estimated in neighborhoods of each point).

local_id¶

skdim.local_id.ESS([ver, d, random_generator])

Local intrinsic dimension estimation using the Expected Simplex Skewness algorithm.

skdim.local_id.FisherS([conditional_number, …])

Local intrinsic dimension estimation using the FisherS algorithm.

skdim.local_id.lPCA([ver, alphaRatio, …])

Local intrinsic dimension estimation using PCA.

skdim.local_id.MiND_ML([k, D, ver])

Intrinsic dimension estimation with the MiND_MLx algorithms.

skdim.local_id.MOM([k])

Intrinsic dimension estimation using the Method Of Moments algorithm.

skdim.local_id.TLE([k, epsilon])

Local intrinsic dimension estimation with the Tight Local Intrinsic Dimensionality Estimator algorithm.

global_id¶

skdim.global_id.CorrInt([k1, k2, DM])

Intrinsic dimension estimation using the Correlation Dimension.

skdim.global_id.DANCo([k, D, …])

Intrinsic dimension estimation with the DANCo (Ceruti et al.

skdim.global_id.KNN([k, ps, M, gamma])

Intrinsic dimension estimation with the kNN algorithm.

skdim.global_id.Mada([k, comb, DM, local])

Intrinsic dimension estimation using the Manifold-adaptive dimension estimation algorithm.

skdim.global_id.MLE([mode, k, dnoise, …])

Intrinsic dimension estimation with the Maximum Likelihood method.

skdim.global_id.TwoNN([discard_fraction, dist])

Class to calculate the intrinsic dimension of the provided data points with the TWO-NN algorithm.
